title: Go spec shows it is possible to define identical named types. However, it is impossible.
body:
### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?

go1.7.1 linux/amd64

### What did you do?

See this discussion for details: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-nuts/7d_B1AhI5ho 

https://play.golang.org/p/PmkcvdNQnx

### What did you expect to see?

Either of the two:
1. "fmt.Println(a == b)" should return true in the play example above.
2. this line "Two named types are identical if their type names originate in the same TypeSpec." in go spec should be removed, for there is no ways to define identical named types.
